results.title: Don Giovanni
results.creator_credit: Opera Australia, ABC-TV (Australia) and Peter Butler
results.brief_description: Sung in Italian with English subtitles, this opera combines comedy and tragedy to produce the story of Don Giovanni. The central character of Giovanni is the anti-hero, a brilliant, irresponsible villain, an amourous libertine who receives his comeupances by refusing to repent. Performers on the tape include Lisa Gasteen, Gilli Sullivan, Fiona Janes and David Hobson. The performance was part of an Esso night at the opera,recorded live at the Sydney Opera House, January 1991 and was directed by Lindy Hume. Featuring the Australian Opera and Ballet Orchestra, conducted by Gyorgy Fischer, this performance was based on the production by Goran Jarvefelt.

results.title: Don Carlo
results.creator_credit: Clemente D'Alessio, Metropolitan Opera (New York, N.Y.) and Brian Large
results.brief_description: This wonderful and lavish production of Don Carlo by Giuseppe Verdi was recorded live at the Metropolitan Opera on 26 March 1983 and performed by an extraordinary cast including Placido Domingo in the role of Don Carlo, with Mirella Freni (Elizabeth of Valois), Grace Bumbry (The Princess Eboli), Louis Quilico (Rodrigo), Nicolai Ghiaurov (King Philip) and Ferruccio Furlanetto (The Grand Inquisitor). Production by John Dexter and featuring the Metropolitan Opera Orchestra conducted by James Levine and the Metropolitan Opera Chorus lead by chorus master David Stivender. Also included on this tape is a special short program “Verdi at San’t Agata” about Verdi’s beautiful villa which is now preserved just as he left it. Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Don Carlo
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Covent Garden Video Productions and Brian Large
results.brief_description: Opera is arguably the best medium for dramatising history and this is particularly true for Verdi’s “Don Carlo” in Luchino Visconti’s magnificent and definitive 1958 production. Set in France and Spain in the second half of the 16th century, the five act opera tells of the political and amorous rivalry between Philip II of Spain and his son, Don Carlo. Bernard Haitink conducts The Orchestra of the Royal Opera House and a superb cast is led by Ileana Cotrubas as a tender and touching Elisabetta accompanied by the fine lyric tenor Luis Lima in the title role. Sung in Italian and English.

results.title: Don Breaks Out
results.brief_description: A profile of an enthusiast - a man whose fascination with the motion picture is equalled only by his fondness for creating instruments to make music. Maritimer Don Fletcher, ex-prison guard, now film projectionist, explains to an audience of university students how he came to make films, and also demonstrates how he built a violin unlike any other, which nevertheless pours out the real down-east country sound.

results.title: Don Bradman: 87 not out
results.brief_description: Born in Cootamundra, New South Wales on 27 August 1908, Don Bradman was eventually to become an Australian icon, and a somewhat reluctant hero. His family moved to Bowral when he was only two years old and he was educated at the local Bowral Elementary School, focusing on sport rather than an academic life. Without any formal coaching, Don Bradman soon found he had a special talent as a batsman when at the age of 12 he played for the senior school team and scored 115 not out. He has played in 52 test matches and scored a total of 6,996 runs, the highest scorer ever. This documentary provides an insight into this quiet unassuming person who dislikes publicity and giving interviews. Interviewed by Ray Martin, Sir Donald Bradman talks of his background, his family and of course his amazing cricketing career, providing anecdotal stories of some of the more memorable occasions such as the Bodyline series in Adelaide in 1933. The interview is interspersed with archival footage and still photographs of past test matches, tours, famous faces such as Harold Larwood, Frank Tyson, Gary Sobers and Dennis Lillee, and brief glimpses of his personal life including his wife and family. A most interesting history of cricket from a frank and honest point of view by one of the game’s highly respected players - and in his words, “Cricket is a glorious game” (Sir Donald Bradman died on 25 February 2001 at the age of 92). “Don Bradman” composed and performed by John Williamson.

results.title: Don Bosco
results.creator_credit: Alfio Sugaroni, Rizzoli Film and Leandro Castellani
results.brief_description: Born a peasant in Turin, Don Bosco (Ben Gazzara) has always known his vocation, thanks to an extremely significant dream. He welcomes poor, abandoned boys to his oratory and promptly teaches them to be charitable in accordance with the Christian doctrine. His power to sway souls away from the perils of greed and avarice frightens many people who repeatedly try to stop him, but without success. Self-assured, Don Bosco decides to found a congregation with its own rules but still has to contend with pressure from the Arch-Bishop of Turin.

results.title: Don't tell me I'll find out (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Quick and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies”.
Organisms: includes first grade children observing aquaria and seed planting. Lifecycles: second graders plant and observe growth of beans, also observe fruitfly in pupae and adult stages. Populations: third grade children observe crickets eating clover and chameleons eating crickets, introducing the terms predator and prey.

results.title: Don't start off with an accident
results.creator_credit: Reg Perier, Perier Films, New South Wales. Dept. of Labour and Industry and Stan Murdoch
results.brief_description: Starts with a young recruit to a production factory who has a minor accident with equipment. Shows the many dangers with improper equipment handling and the importance of safety training. Expands to cover safety aspects of other industries, particularly building.
